comment._content: Dunnottar Castle from the west,, September 1990.

comment.author: 32375815@N07
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/swalker5872/3039540962/] Pano shot from 2008, some things never change much.
Edited 20/4/09. Put on link to show that things have not changed much in the last hundred odd years. I would really recommend anyone who gets the change to visit, as no picture I have seen does the setting credit not even our 100 year old picture above. Sorry if there was any confusion.

comment.author: 22566720@N04
comment._content: i still prefer the old one to all of the new digitial versions, looks so much better

comment.author: 81472222@N00
comment._content: I am always interested in history. This is very interesting stuff. I have a series on my Flickr site in my sets where I have done a similar thing to places here in Australia. Most of the pics have been taken about 20 years apart.

comment.author: 24736216@N07
comment._content: Not surprising, Simon.  I prefer the old one, too.  We are comparing a professionally created photolithograph, made for sale, with various people's amateur photos, mainly made for their own travel souvenirs.

comment.author: 21781391@N07
comment._content: The bridge doesn't exist any longer, hasn't done for a long long time.

comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called ANYTHING GOES SCOTLAND,VINTAGE PHOTOS,POSTCARDS,EPHEMERAetc..., and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 29619972@N00
comment._content: These old pictures are so epic.

comment.author: 36988215@N08
comment._content: researching scottish family history from across the sea - I include historical data and to be able to see old images of where  ancestors had been makes the research a little more meaningful and magical.
